sentences.en: A degree of cautious optimism is justified.
sentences.cn: 表现出一定程度的谨慎乐观是合乎情理的。

sentences.en: A mood of optimism swept through the company and its customers.
sentences.cn: 公司上下及其顾客都洋溢着一股乐观情绪。

sentences.en: As she spoke she felt a bubble of optimism rising inside her.
sentences.cn: 当她讲话时，她感到内心的乐观情绪越来越高涨。

sentences.en: Both parties expressed optimism about an eventual solution.
sentences.cn: 双方对问题的最终解决都表示乐观.

sentences.en: Despite his misfortunes, his faith and optimism remained intact.
sentences.cn: 虽然他遭到一连串的不幸, 他的信心和乐观丝毫未减.

sentences.en: Don't pour cold water on their optimism.
sentences.cn: 别给他们的乐观态度泼冷水.

sentences.en: His optimism blinded him to many problems.
sentences.cn: 他的乐观态度使他对许多问题视而不见.

sentences.en: I set off, full of optimism.
In the interview he gave some grounds for optimism.
sentences.cn: 他接受采访时阐述了持乐观态度的理由。

sentences.en: Optimism made him alive through the hard days.
sentences.cn: 乐观主义使他在艰难的岁月里活了下来.

sentences.en: Optimism was gradually taking the place of pessimism.
sentences.cn: 乐观情绪逐渐取代了悲观主义。

sentences.en: The president struck a note of warning against over - optimism.
sentences.cn: 总统的话有警告大家不要过分乐观的暗示.

sentences.en: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
They have maintained their optimism in the face of desolating subjugation.
sentences.cn: 面对遭征服的悲惨命运，他们保持了乐观的态度。

sentences.en: Your optimism has been badly shaken over the past months.
sentences.cn: 在过去的几个月中你的乐观态度已经大为动摇。

trans.tran_en: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen
